oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Report from the Multi-Messenger Working Group at UHECR-2014 Conference
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Karg, Timo
Collaboration, for the IceCube
Alvarez-Muñiz, Jaime
Kuempel, Daniel
Settimo, Mariangela
Collaboration, for the Pierre Auger
Rubtsov, Grigory
Troitsky, Sergey
Collaboration, for the Telescope Array
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Astrophysics - High Energy Astrophysical Phenomena
Astrophysics - Instrumentation and Methods for Astrophysics
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The IceCube, Pierre Auger and Telescope Array Collaborations have recently reported results on neutral particles (neutrons, photons and neutrinos) which complement the measurements on charged primary cosmic rays at ultra-high energy. The complementarity between these messengers and between their detections are outlined. The current status of their search is reviewed and a cross-correlation analysis between the available results is performed. The expectations for photon and neutrino detections in the near future are also presented.
Comment: 13 pages, 5 figures, Proceeding of UHECR 2014 conference, Springdale, Utah, USA; accepted for publication in JPS Conference Proceedings
